article:
'Simmering' is a food preparation technique in which foods are cooked in hot
liquids kept at or just below the boiling point of
water [http://culinaryarts.about.com/od/glossary/g/simmer.htm Simmer
definition] from [http://culinaryarts.about.com/ About.com - Culinary arts].
Retrieved May 2009. (which is 100 Â°C or 212 Â°F at average sea level
air pressure), but higher than poaching temperature. To keep a pot
simmering, one brings it to a boil and then reduces the heat to a point
where the formation of bubbles has all but ceased, typically a water
temperature of about 94 Â°C (200 Â°F).
